snippet: The Muslim Brotherhood is facing perhaps the worst crisis in its 80-year history, a surprising fall for a group that came to power just a year ago.
abstract: Muslim Brotherhood, among the most powerful forces in Egypt, is facing perhaps the worst crisis in its 80-year history, surprising fall for a group that came to power just a year ago; members have been gunned down in the streets, new headquarters have been ransacked and burned and Pres Mohamed Morsi, group's political leader, has been abandoned, threatened and isolated by old foes and recent allies.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Sarah Mousa and Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Muslim Brotherhood is facing perhaps the worst crisis in its 80-year history, a surprising fall for a group that came to power just a year ago.

headline.main: Depth of Discontent Threatens Muslim Brotherhood and Its Leader
headline.print_headline: Depth of Discontent Threatens A Movement and Its Leader

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
